intro: Emilia tessmannii, commonly known as the Tessmann's emilia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer. Emilia tessmannii is typically found in coastal and rocky habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
